1. Purpose

The purpose of this policy is to provide employees with clear guidelines regarding leave entitlements, procedures for requesting leave, and the types of leave available, ensuring fairness and consistency across the organization.

2. Scope

This policy applies to all full-time and part-time employees of [Company Name].

3. Types of Leave
3.1 Annual Leave / Paid Time Off (PTO)

Employees are entitled to [X] days of paid leave per calendar year.

Leave accrues [monthly/quarterly/annually].

Unused leave may be [carried forward / encashed / forfeited] as per company rules.

Leave must be requested [at least X days in advance].

3.2 Sick Leave

Employees are entitled to [X] days of sick leave per year.

A medical certificate may be required for absences exceeding [X] days.

Sick leave can be availed in case of illness, injury, or medical emergencies.

3.3 Casual Leave

Employees are entitled to [X] days of casual leave per year.

Casual leave is meant for urgent personal matters or short-term absences.

Leave should be requested [preferably 1 day in advance].

3.4 Maternity / Paternity Leave

Female employees are entitled to [X weeks/months] of maternity leave as per applicable law.

Male employees are entitled to [X days/weeks] of paternity leave.

Leave can be availed before or after delivery as per HR approval.

3.5 Bereavement / Compassionate Leave

Employees are entitled to [X days] of leave in case of death or serious illness of an immediate family member.

Leave must be requested as soon as possible.

3.6 Unpaid Leave

Employees may request unpaid leave subject to managerial approval.

Unpaid leave does not count toward paid leave accrual.

4. Leave Application Procedure

Employees must submit leave requests through [HR system / email / form].

Requests should include:

Type of leave

Dates of leave

Reason for leave (if required)

Managers must approve or reject leave within [X business days].

HR will record and monitor leave balances.

5. Leave Encashment

Employees may encash [X days] of unused annual leave at the end of the year or upon termination.

Encashment will be calculated based on basic salary.

6. General Guidelines

Leave should not adversely affect team operations.

Unauthorized absence may result in disciplinary action.

Employees must update contact information if reachable during leave.

7. Policy Review

This policy will be reviewed annually or as required to comply with applicable laws and company needs.
